page.title: 08The Church in Earls Croome.
page.content: St. Nicholas{anglican church}in Earls Croome was built in the 12th century. Most of it is the original work. The tower gallery and vestry were added in 1832. There is a memorial to four local men who died in the 1914 war. The candelabra are believed to be a gift from Worcester Cathedral. Since the last resident rector retired the church has been served from Ripple. There is a thriving {Womens Institute}in the village and the only{Mothers Union}in the diocese since the early years of the church times have changed, now all denominations worship and enjoy social occasions together.{Womens World Day {of Prayer}services are celebrated in alternate years in the three churches of the Parish.
